meanings.definition: The ending of a romantic relationship.
meanings.sent1: Breakups can be tough, but they can also lead to new beginnings.
meanings.sent2: She felt sad after the breakups with her boyfriend.
meanings.sent3: After their breakups, they both realized they were better off as friends.
meanings.sent4: The breakups in her past taught her valuable lessons about love.
meanings.sent5: The breakups left a lasting impact on her heart.

meanings.sent1: The breakups in the company led to a lot of changes in the office.
meanings.sent2: The breakups between the two countries caused tension in the region.
meanings.sent3: The breakups of the land were clearly marked by the river.
meanings.sent4: The breakups in the family created a rift that was hard to mend.
meanings.sent5: The breakups of the group affected their dynamics significantly.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking something into pieces.
meanings.sent1: The breakups of the glass shattered it into tiny fragments.
meanings.sent2: He carefully avoided any breakups of the delicate vase.
meanings.sent3: The breakups of the cookie made it easier to share with friends.
meanings.sent4: The breakups of the rock revealed a beautiful crystal inside.
meanings.sent5: The breakups of the puzzle made it challenging to put back together.
